io.pmem.pmemkv

Class Database.ReadIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.pmem.pmemkv.Database.ReadIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Enclosing class:
    Database<K,V>

    public class Database.ReadIterator
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Binding for a pmemkv (read) iterator API. ReadIterator provides methods to iterate over records in db. It allows reading record's key and value, but not modify them. Any changes to iterators will not be reflected in the database. This object can only be created using Database method: readIterator() .

    Holding simultaneously, in the same thread, more than one iterator is undefined behavior.

    IMPORTANT: This is an EXPERIMENTAL feature and should not be used in production code. For now, we don't guarantee stability of this API.

    • Method Detail

      • seek

        public boolean seek(K key)
             throws DatabaseException
        Changes iterator position to a record with the given key.

        If the record is present and no errors occurred, returns true. If the record does not exist, false is returned and the iterator position is undefined. It internally aborts all uncommitted changes made to an element previously pointed by the iterator.

        Parameters:
        key - key to seek.
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - or derived class that matches pmemkv's status.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • seekLower

        public boolean seekLower(K key)
                  throws DatabaseException
        Changes iterator position to a record with a key lower than the given key.

        If the record is present and no errors occurred, returns true. If the record does not exist, false is returned and the iterator position is undefined. It internally aborts all uncommitted changes made to an element previously pointed by the iterator.

        Parameters:
        key - key to seek.
        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - or derived class that matches pmemkv's status.
        Since:
        1.2.0

        Parameters:

      • seekToFirst

        public boolean seekToFirst()
                    throws DatabaseException
        Changes iterator position to a first record.

        If db isn't empty and no errors occurred, returns true. If db is empty, false is returned and the iterator position is undefined. It internally aborts all uncommitted changes made to an element previously pointed by the iterator.

        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - or derived class that matches pmemkv's status.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • seekToLast

        public boolean seekToLast()
                   throws DatabaseException
        Changes iterator position to a last record.

        If db isn't empty and no errors occurred, returns true. If db is empty, false is returned and the iterator position is undefined. It internally aborts all uncommitted changes made to an element previously pointed by the iterator.

        Returns:
        true if success, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - or derived class that matches pmemkv's status.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • key

        public K key()
      throws DatabaseException,
             OutOfMemoryError
        Returns the entire key of a record currently pointed by the iterator. It is just a copy of the current record - key cannot be updated in the Database using this method.

        If the iterator is on an undefined position, calling this method is undefined behaviour.

        Returns:
        key of type K
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - or derived class that matches pmemkv's status.
        OutOfMemoryError - Exception will be thrown when buffer cannot be allocated in DRAM.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • value

        public V value()
        throws DatabaseException,
               OutOfMemoryError
        Returns the entire value of a record currently pointed by the iterator. It is just a copy of the current record - data cannot be written to the Database using this method.

        If the iterator is on an undefined position, calling this method is undefined behaviour.

        Returns:
        value of type V
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - or derived class that matches pmemkv's status.
        OutOfMemoryError - Exception will be thrown when buffer cannot be allocated in DRAM.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • isNext

        public boolean isNext()
        Checks if there is a next record available.

        If true is returned, it is guaranteed that iterator.next() will return status::OK, otherwise iterator is already on the last element and iterator.next() will return false.

        Returns:
        true if there is a next record available, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • next

        public boolean next()
        Changes iterator position to the next record.

        If the next record exists, returns true, otherwise false is returned and the iterator position is undefined.

        Returns:
        true if the iterator was moved on the next record, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • close

        public void close()
        Releases underlying resources.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Since:
        1.2.0
